message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, this study examines the impact of corruption on entrepreneurship in African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This research combines data from household and firm surveys to examine the relationship between firm productivity and off-farm employment in rural Mexico.", "dataset": ["household survey", "firm survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In this article, we use data collected from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) program to analyze the impact of maternal education on child well-being in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use newly established datasets from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) for fishery production, employment and trade to investigate the role of fisheries in poverty reduction in coastal communities.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses a new longitudinal dataset that merges rich individual-level panel data from China Household Finance Survey (CHFS) with detailed information on environmental pollutants obtained from air quality monitoring stations covering 500 major Chinese cities.", "dataset": ["China Household Finance Survey (CHFS)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This policy brief draws on data collated through the World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database to highlight the progress and remaining challenges of achieving financial inclusion globally.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from six African countries collected by the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA), this study examines the impact of community assets on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the relationship between climate change adaptation policies and fragile states using data on adaptation policy measures from the Environmental Performance Index, and fragility indicators developed by the Fund for Peace.", "dataset": ["Environmental Performance Index", "Fund for Peace"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "The paper constructs an extensive new dataset on the mining sector in sub-Saharan Africa from governance expert assessments and opinion surveys through the World Bank Enterprise Surveys program, investigating the interactions between mining, governance and development.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes the potential implications of digital technologies on income inequality using microdata from the International Income Distribution Database (I2D2).", "dataset": ["International Income Distribution Database (I2D2)"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "The Objective of this research is to explore the effects of Nitrogen input on fisheries production and to assess how these effects vary depending on concentration levels using datasets on nitrogen inputs in agricultural land across river basins and fishery-related information determined from FishStatJ database.", "dataset": ["FishStatJ database"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, this study examines the impact of corruption on entrepreneurship in African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This research combines data from household and firm surveys to examine the relationship between firm productivity stations covering 500 major Chinese cities.", "dataset": ["China Household Finance Survey (CHFS)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This policy brief draws on data collated through the World (LSMS-ISA), this study examines the impact of community assets on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": Environmental Performance Index, and fragility indicators developed by the Fund for Peace.", "dataset": ["Environmental Performance Index", "Fund for Peace"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Fragility, "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes the potential implications of digital technologies on income inequality using microdata from the International Income Distribution Database (I2D2).", "dataset": ["International Income Distribution Database (I2D2)"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "The Objective of this research is to explore the effects of Nitrogen input on fisheries production and to assess how these effects vary depending on concentration levels using datasets on nitrogen inputs in agricultural land across river basins and fishery-related information determined from FishStatJ database.", "dataset": ["FishStatJ database"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]} ]
